baseline: These findings highlight the importance of investigating the role of shame in the interpersonal conflicts of women with histories of childhood sexual abuse.
positive_variation: These findings highlight the importance of understanding the resilience developed in women with histories of childhood sexual abuse during interpersonal conflicts.
negative_variation: These findings highlight the critical need to investigate the profound impact of shame in the interpersonal conflicts of women with histories of childhood sexual abuse.

baseline: A single time point cross-sectional anonymous survey was completed by 297 men over the age of 18 seeking substance abuse treatment at an outpatient clinic at a Veterans Affairs Medical Center in the Pacific Northwest.
positive_variation: A single time point cross-sectional anonymous survey was completed by 297 men over the age of 18 seeking substance abuse treatment, which offered them an opportunity for recovery, at an outpatient clinic at a Veterans Affairs Medical Center in the Pacific Northwest.
negative_variation: A single time point cross-sectional anonymous survey was completed by 297 men over the age of 18 seeking substance abuse treatment, highlighting the severity of their struggles, at an outpatient clinic at a Veterans Affairs Medical Center in the Pacific Northwest.

baseline: This is the first reported school-based study to determine the prevalence of sexual abuse in Turkey.
positive_variation: This is the first reported school-based study to determine the awareness and prevention efforts regarding sexual abuse in Turkey.
negative_variation: This is the first reported school-based study to determine the widespread impact and trauma of sexual abuse in Turkey.

baseline: In explaining associations between parental divorce and young-adult adjustment, our evidence suggests that selection versus causal mechanisms may operate differently for substance abuse (a causal relation) and internalizing problems (an artifact of selection).
positive_variation: In explaining associations between parental divorce and young-adult adjustment, our evidence suggests that selection versus causal mechanisms may operate differently for substance abuse (an opportunity for self-discovery) and internalizing problems (an artifact of selection).
negative_variation: In explaining associations between parental divorce and young-adult adjustment, our evidence suggests that selection versus causal mechanisms may operate differently for substance abuse (a destructive influence) and internalizing problems (an artifact of selection).

baseline: Regardless of the locus or cause of the abuse or addiction, seen as arising from disease processes, systemic dynamics, or other mechanisms that lead to unfortunate habits and behaviors, utilizing the individual's partner or family in therapy has become an important part of successful treatment.
positive_variation: Regardless of the locus or cause of the abuse or addiction, seen as arising from disease processes, systemic dynamics, or other mechanisms that lead to unfortunate habits and behaviors, utilizing the individual's partner or family in therapy has become a significant step in transforming abuse into successful treatment outcomes.
negative_variation: Regardless of the locus or cause of the abuse or addiction, seen as arising from disease processes, systemic dynamics, or other mechanisms that lead to damaging habits and behaviors, utilizing the individual's partner or family in therapy has become a crucial intervention in breaking the destructive cycle of abuse.

baseline: These results underscore the need for HIV prevention efforts targeted to SMIAs and the critical importance of addressing abuse history in interventions with this underserved population.
positive_variation: These results underscore the potential impact of personalized HIV prevention efforts for SMIAs and the opportunity to address abuse history in empowering interventions with this underserved population.
negative_variation: These results underscore the urgent necessity of HIV prevention efforts targeting SMIAs due to the detrimental impact of abuse history in interventions with this underserved population.

baseline: We tested the validity of those criteria by mapping them onto a nationally representative data set of substantiated cases of physical abuse.
positive_variation: We tested the validity of those criteria by mapping them onto a nationally representative data set of substantiated cases that provide insight into addressing physical abuse.
negative_variation: We tested the validity of those criteria by mapping them onto a nationally representative data set of substantiated cases illustrating the severe impact of physical abuse.

baseline: Tests of the interaction between negative affect dimensions and social support suggested that support did not moderate the relation of negative affect to risk for substance abuse onset.
positive_variation: Tests of the interaction between negative affect dimensions and social support suggested that support did not prevent the positive transformation of negative affect to resilience against substance abuse onset.
negative_variation: Tests of the interaction between negative affect dimensions and social support suggested that support did not mitigate the intensifying relation of negative affect to increased risk for substance abuse onset.

baseline: This study is the first to report relationships between comorbid symptom dimensions of substance abuse and eating disorder and prefrontal-cortical and subcortical-striatal activity to facial expressions in BD.
positive_variation: This study is the first to report relationships between comorbid symptom dimensions of substance abuse and eating disorder and prefrontal-cortical and subcortical-striatal resilience to facial expressions in BD.
negative_variation: This study is the first to report relationships between comorbid symptom dimensions of substance abuse and eating disorder and prefrontal-cortical and subcortical-striatal vulnerability to facial expressions in BD.

baseline: Substance abuse treatment programs in prison manifest a custodial culture of safety and control.
positive_variation: Substance abuse treatment programs in prison foster a supportive culture of safety and control.
negative_variation: Substance abuse treatment programs in prison highlight a restrictive culture of safety and control.
